div.head: 陽事不興
div.div: failure of the yang thing to rise

bibl.title: Ben cao gang mu dictionary Vol1

entry.def: failure of the yang thing to rise

sense.def: Pathological Condition identical with yin wei 陰痿 , dysfunction of the yin [member, i.e. penis]. Pu ji fang 普濟方 227: 安腎丸，治男子諸風，五勞七傷，顏色枯朽，手足不遂，語言謇 澀，口眼歪斜，筋脈攣急，腰脚疼痛…及陽事不興，胃冷精流 , “The pills to calm the kidneys cure all types of male wind, the five types of exhaustion and seven types of harm, withered and decayed complexion, when hands and feet do not follow one’s wishes, with impaired language, wry mouth and eyes, cramped sinews and vessels, painful lower back and legs … as well as failure of the yang thing to rise , and stomach cold with [involuntary] seminal pollution”.
